author: rivals.com
title: Safety Geno Stone is headed to Iowa. Two days after making h
text:
Safety Geno Stone is headed to Iowa. Two days after making his official visit to Iowa, safety Geno Stone has switched his verbal commitment to the Hawkeyes. The 6-foot-0, 188-pound Pennsylvania native, who was previously committed to Kent State, made the announcement this afternoon.
"I want to thank the staff at Kent State for everything and thankful for the opportunity to play at the school," said Stone in a statement. "But after talking with my family and friends I decided it's the best thing for me to decommit from Kent State and pursue my dreams at the University of Iowa."
Blessings! üôèüèæ pic.twitter.com/wKtPOQATYL
‚Äî G‚óæÔ∏è (@GenoStone22) January 31, 2017 A two-star prospect, Stone is commitment No. 19 for the Hawkeyes in the Class of 2017.
See highlights from Stone's senior year at New Castle High School in the video below.
